CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 3, 1954, pg. 5, reads: "People of All Races Mourned - How well Patrolman William (Bill) Heagy was liked was shown by the large crowd which gathered outside the North Side funeral home at Chateau Street and Pennsylvania Avenue last Tuesday afternoon when funeral services for the Hill District officer were held.  Many Negroes were among those in the crowd.  The Mayor and City Council members attended as well as uniformed member of the Fraternal Order of Police.  Patrolman Heagy and his partner, Officer (now Detective) Charles (Chic) Morrison delivered more than thirty 'emergency' births while they served as ambulance patrolmen in the Hill District. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Crowd, including police officers, gathered behind iron fence of funeral home, for funeral of police officer William "Bill" Heagy, Chateau Street and Pennsylvania Avenue, Northside
